meet alejandro "alex" garcía, a 37-year-old mexican immigrant living in the dallas-fort worth metropolitan area of texas. alex has been in the united states for about 8 years and identifies as hispanic, with mexican origin. he is currently separated from his wife, ana, and they have two children, aged 6 and 8, who live with their mother. alex lives in a small apartment in the oak cliff neighborhood of dallas.

alex's educational background includes some college coursework in business administration from a community college in mexico before moving to the u.s. he did not complete a degree but has taken various certification courses to improve his skills. alex works as a supervisor at a mexican restaurant in the oak cliff area, earning $42,500 per year. he does not own a home and pays $1,100 per month in rent.

alex is a devout roman catholic and attends mass at least once a month at the local parish. he values his faith and believes it plays a crucial role in his life. as an undocumented immigrant, alex is not eligible to vote but stays informed about politics and current events through online news outlets, social media, and conversations with friends and family. he is largely liberal in his ideology, sympathetic to the democratic party, and often finds himself aligned with their immigration policies.

despite his undocumented status, alex is an active volunteer in his community, participating in local events and helping out at a nearby food bank. he is fluent in spanish and has basic proficiency in english, which he continues to improve through language classes at a local community center.

alex's economic concerns center around providing for his children's education and securing a stable future for his family. he worries about his undocumented status and the impact it has on his ability to pursue better job opportunities or apply for loans to further his education. alex's experiences as an immigrant have shaped his views on immigration reform, and he strongly supports a pathway to citizenship for undocumented immigrants.

in his free time, alex enjoys playing soccer with friends, trying out new recipes in the kitchen, and staying up-to-date with news from mexico. he uses the internet frequently to stay connected with family and friends, both in the u.s. and in mexico. alex's story reflects the complexities and challenges faced by many undocumented immigrants in the united states, and his perspectives on politics, economy, and social issues are shaped by his unique experiences.
